The place was pretty busy on the outside, but kind of empty on the inside so we sat at the bar inside.  We were immediately greeted by two ladies behind the bar and given a food menu.  All seemed to be going well, but when you sit at the bar area, you see everything that happens behind the counter and what I saw was beyond foul and dangerous.    The only male bartender who was making the drinks behind the counter, first of all, was obviously intoxicated while on the job.  He was obnoxiously loud and having a difficult time pouring and mixing the drinks because he had more alcohol and ice on the counter compared to what went into the actual glasses and pitchers.  If Jon Taffer was there, he would have yelled at his ass, that's for sure.  Then, I noticed where the bartender was scooping his ice from when he was making the drinks.  He was scooping the ice from an open ice box where they also stored alcohol bottles.   I'm not a bartender, but I'm almost sure for health and inspection reasons, you're not supposed to store bottles in the same ice box as the ice cubes that you're serving in your drinks for sanitary reasons.  To make matters worse, the bartender was using a metal shaker and chipped glasses while making his drinks.  I don't know if he was too intoxicated to notice or if he just didn't care if customers accidentally drank glass chips or cut their lips on broken glasses.  I mean, you've got to wonder where the broken glass chips are if they're no longer on the actual glass.  After he was done making the drinks, he left the chipped glasses upside down on the counter and left.  He didn't wipe down or clean his station.  He left the melted ice and alcohol that he had spilled all over the counter drip over the edge of the counter and into the ice box that had the ice that he was serving to customers.  GROSS!!  I just kept watching the liquid drip from the nasty wooden counter and collect into the ice.  We had ordered nachos which came out super fast and as I was eating and watching all of this happen right in front of my eyes, I just lost my appetite.  If this is happening out in the open, I don't want to imagine how it is behind the scenes and how sanitary the kitchen would be!  We didn't finish the nachos, but I guess that was a good thing because underneath all of the chips was nothing, but a pool of oil.  Ewwww.  I have to say that the blonde girl with the short hair who was serving us did a great job on checking up and making sure we were taken care of.  Other than that, stay far away from this place if you don't want to drink broken glass!

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The pool of oil/liquid at the bottom of the nachos.

Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Spilled alcohol &amp; melted ice were dripping over the edge of the counter and into the ice box containing ice that is being served to customer

zXZXIJ5zS4yWPvsvLr_k3Q.text: Went here because we were craving Mexican food. We live in Scottsdale and have always wanted to try this place! We wanted to sit outside but it was chilly and the manager was nice enough to move a heater right next to us to make sure we were comfortable. Our server was Maria and she was so fun and provided awesome and quick service! The food and drinks were great and my husband and I will definitely be returning!

3_meGmfqOErMdVC7Afonuw.text: I enjoyed myself very much. My sister was visiting in town and we wanted to go to a relaxed atmosphere that served good drinks. We found our place. It was a Friday afternoon we had a couple of margaritas as well as fajitas and fish tacos. Delicious. Our waitress was friendly. It was a cool day. Salty's has a spacious patio on the front and the back. Lots of opportunities to people watch.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos and frozen mango margarita. Yum..

m8csDdvZJwmcivXuJ5d6Nw.text: Best Guacamole- ever! Freshly made, you can taste the fresh ingredients and there's no overpowering spice that keeps you from enjoying it to the last bite! Yum!! Thanks Leia for an awesome experience!!!  You definitely make the best guac!! You rock!!!

y5otU4xtydIPOSyez1GVqg.text: Just a big shout out to John Maryak and the crew at Salty Senorita for the wonderful food, drink, and exceptional service at the Happy Hour we hosted last week prior to our son's wedding. The Margaritas are fabulous and the prices are so reasonable - you have to try it! And loved the fire pit and local good vibes. You're a treasure John and we will be back!

NF5EhhiFWEXh8g6qH3wybQ.text: Stopped in on Saturday for Cinco de mayo and had the best service I've had on such a busy day Leia was great she was slammed but somehow was able to always make sure we were taken care of we will be back for sure!!!!

AgjsAdPm83HDuf5mM3_r7A.text: Bar tender was horrible. Chips and salsa were so not authentic.  I won't ever go back

ekuIzjVo8KjIbU6bU1VKIA.text: Ok place, Ok food. Friendly attentive waitress. Will visit again if in the area.

kqEJX16d66ARqrMPW9Zsfw.text: We were in Old Town Scottsdale and most places were pretty busy due to the World Series.  We gave them a try mainly because they were not too busy and had a patio.  Once we were seated by the hostess, our server finally came over after about 5 or so minutes (she mentioned the hostess giving here incorrect description on where the table was).  We ordered drinks and water, and it took about 10 minutes to get the water, which was brought by the hostess.  She apologized and said they didn't have enough servers to cover, but I was unclear if this was normal or if they were short due to someone not coming in.  Either way, they were not THAT busy IMO.  After 20 minutes, we still had no drinks.  When she finally brought them she said the bar was "backed up".  I could see the bar clearly from where we sat, and I've watched bartenders that were slammed; he did not look that busy to me.  We also ordered food, and although my wife's order came out wrong, and we had to flag someone down to fix it.  Once we did, they got her a new plate out extremely quickly.  The manager did come over and talk to us without us complaining or asking for him, so that was really good and proactive on his part.  One thing I did notice though, their outside seating was covered in a fine layer of grit and sand.  Not unexpected for Phoenix when the wind is going, however they seem to keep plates, silverware and napkins at the outside tables at all times.  They were not exactly clean either; if I were them I'd have at least stored them upside down, or better yet brought them out as needed.    I do have to say, their food was quite good.  I enjoyed both the specialty margarita and the wine what we ordered as well.  So to give a synopsis, the good was great but the service was sub-par.  I do not know if this was normal or not, so I would give them another chance.

xZWSsgBBWAwo6hMAqOlz2g.text: The Salty Senorita is one of those places that's "not the worst, not the best."  I've only eaten here when I've had family visiting, as the location is pretty convenient. This restaurant seems like it would be a lot better if they didn't have such a high volume of customers.  I can never tell if they're going for piss drunk college kid-or fancy white pants Scottsdale. Maybe they're going for "I barfed up Jager on my $800 tuxedo." Who knows. Their menu is great, the concepts are great, but the execution is always sloppy, bland, and never quite hits the mark. And you can totally tell that they only hire based on looks because their staff is a joke. Literally some of the worst servers I've ever encountered. Like bloody hell get your act together people, this is your job not your spring break.

zdFS5WXplw5_dfIWBK1qWA.text: Taco Tuesday is the best time to go.  Margaritas are very good.  Service is okay.  There's a very nice, big patio to enjoy.

46VK43tM471ceyIkjXfhww.text: A perfect location in the heart of downtown Scottsdale and a large patio for people watching. The food was not great. I ordered a burrito for lunch. It came 30 minutes later cold and the cheese was not even melted. Service was slow, bathrooms were unkempt, and the food make this a 2 star

dW5y2xBpozAY9PcQPBhijA.text: Wow. Decent food with epically bad service. "The kitchen's really backed up cuz we're really busy tonight" does not constitute an apology for long waits, mixed up orders, and missing items. Good salsa, but the guacamole lacked both salt and acid. Tacos ordered with different proteins and garnishes were remarkably similar in taste and texture (though the Shrimp Shack taco, when it finally showed up, was very good).  By the way, "really busy" was a completely empty dining room and a patio with at least 1/3 empty tables.  Surely there is better food and better service in Old Town Scottsdale.

N4qMLfRW8t8Gv-8aVtvUuA.text: This place is great! The food was wonderful ( try Estelle fish tacos) and the service excellent! Special shout out to our waitress, Laia!! She went above and beyond for us. We so appreciated it!! We sat outside on the porch, but the inside was spacious and welcoming, too.

Udywnp-NQBmjYvkQZRtVHw.text: The only reason i even gave you a star in the first place is because you have to leave just one to post the review.. so here i am giving you a star... GRACIOUSLY.   I came here to celebrate my birthday and brought friends from out of state. We were expectant of a fun environment, good food, incredible drinks, and an overall great experience. welll... we should've known from the fact that no one was here when we walked in at dinner time that we were not going to have what we hoped for.  The playlist is so two thousand and L A T E. that ruined the vibes and makes this restaurant seem like they are inadequate to host a young group of adults just trying to have a good time in old town scottsdale.. (one of arizona's prime locations for tourists.. ~young tourists~)   Our server just completely shat all over us. she had zero personality and in fact made us uncomfortable. she questioned our ID's multiple times and even pointed out that we need to upgrade to a horizontal ID but she would "let it slide for tonight" like valid.. but don't make it a big deal in front of everyone it was awkward! our food was crusty and cold and she also made comments that we needed to eat our food faster so that it wouldn't be cold.. whosaysthat  and there was a crusted hair on the plate.. ew.   my margarita is watery and rebecca's beer was warm. for being a mexican restaurant they don't even give you complimentary chips and salsa and you can order bottomless chips but not bottomless salsa... so what am I gonna eat the chips with? my watery margarita???? nah. she rolled her eyes when we asked for chips and made us feel like a burden.  after reviewing what others had to say about this place i'm sure the manager Jim will hop on and give some half ass apology/patronizing excuse. But don't be fooled.. this place is behind a waste of money and prime space on Scottsdale Road. shoutout to RnR across the street.. should've waited the 45 minutes for a much better experience.   in the bathroom - 2 stalls out of order and a long wait because people were probably shitting from the food poisoning   thank you, next.

ZaCsRSGkIQfh5vk_VcVqKw.text: Had an amazing experience food was delicious, the misters on the patio were so lovely. Our server Sarah J was amazing and had great recommendations. Will be back

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

FkSPQ-BC-mbgisghz5Cyhw.text: Stopped in for lunch. Service is definitely lacking. I had to ask to have my drink refilled. Server was unable to handle two tables at once. I ordered three tacos... steak was super dry, chicken was cold. Even the rice was bad.  Too many other establishments to choose for Mexican. I would skip this one.

uDS_cASmqDYjj3hLZfTShw.text: Solid street taco selection with reasonable prices.  Tons of TVs, so it would be a good spot to watch a game or meet friends.   Family friendly with an extensive kids menu and colors to keep them entertained, while the food is being prepared.   Stop by...

fmG2mkO2vSfnDxgsXZ3A4w.text: Met here with some friends on a Sunday evening. Honestly, this is. 1/5 for vegetarians. Their veggie burrito bowl is not fully vegetarian. The rice and beans are made with chicken broth! I ended up getting the veggie tacos and the asparagus taco.   I requested for the veggie taco to not have the rice and beans however it came with it and I noticed it in the first bite. I sent them back and traded them for the asparagus instead. They tasted much better anyhow. They offered free chips and salsa. The margarita selection looked quite delicious.  It's unlikely that I'll return. Not because of bad service or anything, but more so lack of options for vegetarians/vegans. For drinks, maybe.

69v5mMSEWW75VcjToKamng.text: The place is cute, we sat outside and it was hot but they have water mist so you can feel the cool air breeze. They sat us down really quick and we went straight to ordering drinks! I got Maria's choice margarita and my friend got the jalapeno margarita. Both really good!!  The guacamole was sooooo fresh! It tasted like someone's Mexican abuelita made it! I ordered the corn with shrimp tacos. And she ordered the Ceviche, very brave of her. But it was amazing! The food was so fresh and really good. So why the 4 stars, the chairs were not high enough for the bar table, the menus were sticky and the silverware looked dirty. The service was good and everything else great but I'll come back again!

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

W_ZxP1u1YEC7WMUZGCZWrw.text: I've been here about 5 times now and the food is always great.  I'd rate the place a 5, but the service is always hit or miss; sometimes they're friendly and attentive, but other times they can be slow and inattentive... besides that though, the atmosphere is nice, never too noisy, good vibes overall.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Quesadillas and beach house nachos... I think that&#39;s what they were called
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Fish tacos

6or-YcdKgCIx2NNNnpZXVQ.text: Maria J. our waitress was fantastic. Food was excellent. We are from Peoria and would drive here again. Highly recommend. *  Lauren, our waitress was excellent. She made sure we never had to ask for anything. She was right there for us.

8GUMTTYNaC7Wupke5Hu-qA.text: This is by far one of the least flavorful places I have ever been. We had a table of 10 people and had the slowest and poorest service I have yet to have. The one good thing about here was the traditional guacamole and that's the reason I gave it a one star.

-BVF2Q4EPIufTOG1_VbWJw.text: Service was slow.  Drinks and apps came out with no napkins or silverware.  No check back for drinks.  Food ok, but not memorable.

qiIL4GaLHu0AVjt63gfyNw.text: Chelse was amazing and so attentive. I have been here for bottomless multiple times and she is the best waitress I have ever had. They are right across from RNR but never a long wait for bottomless and great pricing.

kXK37G_GlEAEvTYb-kHlSQ.text: Stopped in after a shopping visit to Old Town Scottdale, looking for a quick drink and appetizer. Quick is a relative term. Had to ask the bar if we had a waitress. The Order for 5 drinks, two of which were just vodka over ice (more on that later) took close to 20 minutes. Good thing they have bottomless chips and salsa.   The place was pretty dirty overall. Glasses, silverware and the table, which was not wiped down before we were seated. Service was ok but not great.   My Margarita, listed as the most popular, was not good in spite of the time it took to make. Too much ice and not enough liquid. The fix it yourself bloody mary bar for the vodka over ice was weak on ingredients- no horse radish.  This place is across the street from R and R, a loud vibrant bar. A deejay and dancing at 1:00 in the afternoon ? It was packed. I asked how Salty competes and was told they can't. Salty gets the overflow crowd, like us. My advise, find another overflow spot.

EaSVR6AvcMx9fud5ldFLRA.text: I wish I could give zero stars. I came with a group of 4. We started with queso dip and we all ordered drinks. Appetizer took 25 mins to come out, and they brought us chips and salsa (no queso). It took them extra long to fix it. Drinks were weak. I tried ordering enchiladas, but because it was spring training, I was told they weren't offered (as well as other menu items), because they take longer to cook. I've never heard something so crazy in my life. Water refills never happened. No one at our table enjoyed our food. Service was actually worse then the food if you can believe that.

0l6ASIUSeLnquJsP8QnKbg.text: You guys - I am SO sad to do this. If you know me, you know I love nothing more than giving glowing, positive reviews to all local businesses. But I guess every now and again you have an experience that just isn't worthy of the praise.   We were craving tacos and my husband wanted to watch the ASU game so we stopped into Salty Senorita for a few beers, grub, and the game. It was a Saturday afternoon and aside from the cool ambiance and a lot of TVs, it was pretty dead. It started off good - we ordered a bucket of coronas for $20 which isn't bad at all for Old Town! I also really enjoy their chips and salsa.   But then, it all went downhill. I ordered 3 tacos - one chicken tinga, one carne asada, and one shrimp. You guys - all 3 tacos lost their bottom as soon as I picked them up! Yep, all of the insides went falling onto my plate. Ummmm, what? Yes, corn tortillas can be sensitive but you're a Mexican restaurant, this shouldn't happen. SO, I proceeded to eat the insides with my fork and tried to salvage as much of the tortilla + ingredients as I could. Not only that, the tacos were SO BLAND. I make them better at home. It was so disappointing. I may have forgiven them for falling apart if they at least had good flavor, but nope! :(   Lastly, the service. Our waitress brought the wrong beers and never {literally never} picked up our dirty dishes. So after 20 minutes of letting them sit in front of us {and she literally walked by 2-3 times}, we took it upon ourselves to set them on the table next to us.   YIKES. This experience was not one to remember and I can honestly say that I won't be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. They looked promising but lost their bottoms and were very bland. :(

FBzj53NoEieQyG-tZPmJvQ.text: Popped in on a whim on a Thursday evening with out of town guests.  Not impressed with place AT ALL!  we sat on the patio at sunset and the hostess sat us.  Waited 15-20 minutes with not a single server coming to wait on us!  As soon as we Are getting up to leave someone shows up. My husband complained to the manager and so she sent over a new server. It just went down hill from there!  We ordered appetizers and they took forever.  We sat with no drinks for 15 minutes. Complained again.  Dinner took an hour to get to us after we ordered.  Anyone who sat at the table behind us on the patio got up and left the restaurant because they didn't get service. Absolutely TERRIBLE!!!! We were so disappointed it didn't matter if the food was good or not.  If I could rate them 0 for service I would!   Worst thing ever, when you are trying to entertain guests from out of town and it's disastrous.  They comped our entire meal/drinks, but it really did not make up for the bad experience.

YfsvPVEb4rRAqh1V8CUzTw.text: Fish tacos had a sliver of fish, bed service, our server (Carolann's H) was extremely ditsy and not once apologetic for her lack of attentiveness to our table. She was rude and not kind. Beer was warm and took 25 minutes. Only thing that was decent were the chips and salsa.

-qxfYYzQCNPyFaT1ZC557Q.text: So , I'd like to start off by saying I came here only once before and it was quite on quote "taco Tuesday "  however they did not have a taco Tuesday but I chose to in fact order a chicken taco (A la carte) . I only ordered ONE but  I should have ordered the meal which comes with 3,  and rice and beans . I immediately  regretted my  decision. I didn't not how ever  regret ordering my margarita  which was ON POINT.  tonight is day 4 on my return and NY bartenders are : Aaron and Moises who are by far THEE..  Not even the but THEE best bartenders in of town.  They are not only accommodating but also personable and friendly who will go above and beyond to your every need.  I would highly  recommend salty due to these gentlemen.  BOOM!

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

oQBFOD-FapjRSXXmGOsV3w.text: The crowded patio attracted me to this place.  The decor and ambiance is pretty cool.  Once I found out they put Sprite in their margaritas I wanted to leave.  Ugh.  Soda does not belong in a margarita.  They even out it in their skinny one which well negates the purpose.  And tastes terrible.    I am glad I stayed because the taco Tuesday deal was a good value and the tacos were tasty.  I had the chicken and the carne asada.  Liked them both.  Seasoned very well.  Our waitress was nice but she brought every table chips except for us.  Multiple baskets to one table but never any to us.  Not sure whether chips and salsa are an appetizer that you have to pay for.  Could be.  If that's the case charging for chips is lame.  If not the case the waitress dropped the ball.  Wasn't a terrible experience and like I said the tacos were tasty.  But margaritas are important to me at restaurants and if they can't get them right I probably won't return.

s8L4GI4mbObNSJObDMXpcA.text: Fave for Mexican food and drinks in Scottsdale.  Very casual but fun vibe.  The short rib taco is to die for!  Going to make this place a part of our annual trip for sure!

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

wQpLRbH17t0y9xVlZ6PFEQ.text: Perla's service was fabulous and I highly recommend the Big Crisp for a Happy Hour snack!!

_ZRTuwNRVPtnyOxynvlQJg.text: Second attempt, same result. Terrible service. Pathetic, cold, bland tacos for $3 each. Ran out of glasses and silverware. Air conditioning blasting directly on our table when it was only 75 degrees outside. So many better options nearby.

VpfXOsrvuMCy_aoofr2dHA.text: Extremely underwhelming experience. Drinks, appetizers, and entrees took forever.. And on a Tuesday night. Everything was painfully salty, very True to the name. Pretty overpriced for such a mediocre dining experience.

viGTLcEfaNQo7wPmI-c9Rw.text: Bad customer service, tasteless burrito,  missing ingrident in food, drinks came more than half way into the meal which by the way came about the same time as the apetizer..... I still didnt get my napkins. I feel like my mexican friends can do better.

Qm_0ZY5i4CQm-3jJDcQZ2A.text: Hey, I loved the breakfast bowl I got here. I think all the breakfast bowls here are really good. Other than that though, the service is just extremely slow.

QGPwGzSCwDjTP6lHQH2UYg.text: I ordered tacos while I was here yesterday and they were absolutely AMAZING! The carne asada ones were my fave. Speaking of faves, our bartender was JK and I'd come back just to chat it up with him! Charming, knowledgeable and easy on the eyes! I would definitely suggest it to anyone who finds themselves in the Old Town area

Bc7a7m5Au5TSuybEXO8lig.text: On a Saturday morning/lunch time, the place was dead..and yet it still took the server 15 minutes to greet us.  As a business that strives on alcohol, I would imagine the servers should be a little older and knowledgeable about the alcohol.  Sadly, our server had to be only 18 or 19 and had no idea about the drinks our group was asking for "hold on let me go ask the bar what that is" As for the food...absolute garbage for what we payed.  I don't like dumb ditsy servers and  awful food.  It makes it even worse when the music is so loud we have to yell at each other to talk.  I just wasn't into it, everything tasted like "well"...just a dirty cheap place.  My mother-in-law asked to talk to the manager after we waited 45 minutes on our food.  We never got his name but he straight up did not care and just said unless something was obviously wrong with our food when we got it, nothing could be done..and he walked away.  well..okay then..but never again!

OwCvetd6NIE9jboTIMudSw.text: Long wait for a table, despite tables clearly being open. After seated waited 20 minutes for a server, and then another 20 to get our drink orders. The worst margarita I've ever had in my life. When discussing margaritas with waitress she rolled her eyes at me as if it was my fault the margaritas were bad. Manager tried to help us but he failed to fix any of the issues. Thoroughly disappointed with every aspect of my visit, especially how terrible the margaritas were. Won't come back for quite awhile, if ever.

VKP6-FHBofqUzlltMkovwQ.text: Avoid at all costs!   This was the worst experience ever.  It took 20 minutes just to get margaritas and over an hour to get our food.  The place was practically empty so it wasn't like they were busy.  We could see two people behind the bar.  One was on the computer and the other just standing around.  When the meals came one had avacado on the tacos after having been told that I was deathly allergic to avacado.  The meal was remailed but that also took a lot of time.  The quesadilla was dry and tastless.  The burrito bowl was over salted and 1 of the 3 tacos was pretty good.  We came here at the recommendation of a friend and we were terribly disappointed.  Luckily we were visiting a long time friend so the time wasn't completely wasted.  It is also very expensive for the portion sizes.  Our poor friend was so embarrased.   Definitely avoid this place.

6xfjy75verIOfT_wuc0L6A.text: Amazing service from Katy behind the bar. Great food and drinks. Great prices and great atmosphere. Will come back again.

ei5MdrTqJlC3ilq9uzQpoA.text: I really wanted to love, love, love this place but was kinda bummed by the service.   They have a fun and festive space, a great outdoor patio  and high energy dj that was rousing the crowd and spinning mash ups like they were facing the electric chair.    Food was decent but because I was driving in Sheriff Joe's county so I had to stick to wine and thats where service fell apart.  I didn't expect a world class wine list by any stretch, but I didn't expect the cute little bartender to act irritated out her mind and roll her eyes when I asked about wine by the glass.  I know its easier to pour a glass of wine then blend a top shelf margarita so I didn't really get the 'tude, but whatevs, we were on vacation and just trying to spend a little cash.  Bus boy was super nice and the bathrooms were clean and there is a decent sized parking lot so thats something.   I just wish they were nicer because we were sent there by a Diamondback player that rents my cousins house and highly recommended it as a fun place for three of the saltiest senoritas in the world.

I-toykyXX2dQVXxMu_-Ryg.text: Confession. It took me almost a year of living in Old Town to make it to Salty's.  This review is only on the drinks, since I didn't eat. I met up with a co-worker for a quick happy hour before my Friday adventures. Parking was kind of ridiculous, so I valet'd. I didn't have cash on me, but the dude was cool to let me hit him up on the way out.  Service was good. Drinks were strong, and cheap. Tons of servers in this place, so flagging someone down isn't really a problem.  The patio looks awesome, but it was so damn hot. Sitting inside with air conditioning really hit the spot.  I'd definitely come back. Seems like a cool place to go with a good group of people.   And although I didn't eat here, the food looked like your standard "mexican" bar fare. Can't be too bad, but can't be too good for you either. Classic. Ha.

0s-_LXUamE4ve8oAu0DAtw.text: Checked this out for lunch/happy hour on a Sunday.  We almost went to RnR but we are glad we picked this place instead.  The patio is misted and cool and they play fun music that isn't blaring so you can actually have a conversation.  The food is at a great price for how yummy it is.  Great flavor pairings all around.  Best combinations in their cilantro ranch hot wings and the senorita chop salad.    Best sandwich of the year award goes to grilled chicken with guacamole, jack cheese, bacon, tomato, and salty slaw served on texas toast (from their menu).  Awesome!  Our service was exceptional.  Real five star material.  After our meal we were looking for a great place to see the sunset.  Our server didn't know (she was pretty fresh) but in a matter of minutes we were approached by another gorgeous waitress that actually sat down with us and hand wrote directions to her favorite spot.  Really sweet.    Good ritas at even better prices.  Thanks, girls!

gqHJE3hr-YyUHD9As6PrDw.text: The tacos were good and interesting combos, but not a lot of food, and the service was pretty lousy (slow and indifferent) even on a slow night.

SOLwI0PAQmiOCkuWZ5mipg.text: We were there on a Saturday because R N R across the street was packed and had an hour wait; we should have waited.   When we asked about specials we were told they don't offer any during spring training because they don't have too.   The place was dead, drinks were overpriced and water downed.  Food was decent.  Our waitress looked like she just got off work at a strip bar.  No reason to go back.

QqMvlN3fWhpXze4QqrL5kA.text: Tory was the most friendly and helpful, I had a great experience here tonight on cinco de mayo. Also the guy with the point tail was excellent! I love this place coming back for sure.

2eIlcvQlhHs6qvMJr_2xyA.text: Great first experience for me, had a Groupon. I had 2 tacos off the happy hour menu, pretty tasty with lots of filling. The drinks were really good and strong enough to get a buzz. Devon was our waitress and was genuinely friendly and very attentive. Will definitely come back when in the area.

FeV3CidMt65wzmtM0_XzFA.text: Lets be honest - This is not a place you are going to come because of the awesome food and decor.   We went twice in the week we spend in Scottsdale and both times had phenomenal and fast service. The patio had a great atmosphere with everybody socializing and you definitely can't beat their happy hour menu ($4 margaritas, yes please!)  The food is bar food, so don't come searching for one of the best meals of your life. However, the servers kept our chips and salsa (yum) well stocked and the table side guacamole was great.   I believe this will be our hangout for many more spring trainings to come.

mBLV6WLo9jBNMzWa-R6c4w.text: There was no one to greet us at the door so we ended up seating ourselves.  It took forever for a server to come to our table and when she did, she was friendly.  The food was just okay and the mist was nice but I will not return mainly because this place is not my kind of a eating establishment ~ it has the feel of a run down dive bar ~ everyone eating on the patio appeared to be over drinking.  But give them a try, you might like them.

_nn9-XYdoLNzs5nDDHj7Wg.text: We stopped here because of the decor and we were craving Mexican. It looks like Joes Crab Shack on the California coast, but smack dab in Arizona!   The outdoor seating under umbrellas was nice, but with the changing sun meant we had to keep rotating seats, and the metal stools got HOT!   Our waitress was very nice, and since we were there for lunch, before happy hour started, we ordered off the lunch specials menu, which were not a bad deal at all.  Happy hour is 3-7 PM daily.   First, we PAID for chips & salsa (although once you pay they are bottomless), and that was good. I got the steak salad, which would have been good but it was 50% made up of cucumbers! I picked all of those out and there wasnt much lettuce around the steak left. My husband got the 2 taco plate, with rice & beans. It was clear that rice & beans had been plated long before the tacos were, so that was cold when we got it. Had to send it back for new rice & beans. The tacos werent bad, but my husband liked the fish one best.  The biggest disappointment was that the margaritas were EXPENSIVE, and when I got the deluxe one it tasted gross. not even sure how to describe the base, as it wasnt lemon-ish or lime-sh, or sweet. Not sure what to call it, but it WASNT good. Stick to beer here.

Z3SJLIlgRvSHfbVoHUm_yw.text: Fun sports bar / food and drinks and people watching with plenty of outdoor seating.  Tons of unique drinks, tasty tacos and TV's to watch sports, and it's right next to the main old town area with the Giants stadium.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

ROAi6Sy_8n55eSzY2UANzA.text: Had a great time at this place! On Mondays they have happy hour all day ! Sat at the bar and our bartender Ben was very attentive and offered us great service. Will be back again (:

mITp67lxd-e1dh5kYWmf-g.text: Called quite a few places in Scottsdale to go have dinner and drinks to celebrate a wedding and most were in helpful. Tortilla flats being the worst. Called saltys and spoke to Sidney was incredible got me a whole back patio. She texted me pictures, asked what if there was any extra she good do. Went above and beyond. Ben the bartender super friendly. Samantha the manager very attentive. After party was ending they boxed all my decorations for me to pick up next day. Unbelievable service.

MCuxrLdXp5vI86awwKltRg.text: I just came in for happy hour and had really great time there. We had awesome service there. We were waited on by the bartender, Ben, who was extremely attentive and friendly. Margaritas were good, food was good. Great price too. I'd definitely recommend this place if you're looking for a fun place to hang out at

Fs5p4t93YfqY-nD1nod8Iw.text: We come into town about once a month, we have always loved the food and the chips and salsa. We were so disappointed. The food was very plain no flavor and the salsa was horrible. It can't be the same cook. I wonder if it changed hands. We asked the waiter for the trio of salsa he said they are cutting back because things have been slow and they only have one salsa now.

3YeVMV88XGfPnYp-lehr_A.text: Great atmosphere. Food was another story. Got a variety of the tacos and the street corn. Maybe it is because I am from California but I wasn't too amused. The meat was dry and the seafood was bland.   By no measure are we margarita experts but was a little watered down.   Enjoyed the service. Attentive and checked on us a perfect amount.

Kx1u1OX9ssFOcv9bOWx-dw.text: Tried finding a good place for taco Tuesday and stumbled here. Awesome service from Alex she was so sweet and super attentive. The tacos were amazing I'll definitely come back.

L6i53TstMy3OhnNBlu0yXw.text: The food was decent but the service was not.  The wait for the drinks was ridiculous. Our waitress Aleesa was nice and sweet but she must have had too many tables as we were nearly done eating ( if the fourth taco wasn't incorrect we woulda have been done) before checked on us.  She did get us the correct taco coming and gave it fir free but it was about a 10-12 minute wait fir that.... we then decided we were gonna move to the bar fir a drink.  Gave aleesa our credit card and told her we'd be st the bar. Sat down and the bartender grabbed his cc slip and didn't wipe the bar top in front of us off ( yes you could tell it was dirty, cilantro and onions that we brushed towards the back of the bar), grabbed us menus and we told him we were just going grab drinks as we had just finished, he gave us "cocktail menus" didn't say hi I'll be back in a moment, do you know what you'd like ( we didn't really need the menus because we know what we drink) he said nothing. After sitting there for about 5 minutes with no greeting from the bartender and no cc returned I had to go ask the host to find my card.  (5 employees/manager standing st the host stand talking- which was irritating as clearly the bartender and server needed help).  Again alleeesa was nice but you could tell she was overwhelmed so I dont think her bad  service was her fault, but as far as the bartender I'd give him a zero and probably wouldn't go back on his service and the other employees standing and not helping out.

63prU0Jh9w1IqyTC-SVYow.text: We were looking for a place to eat after a Spring Training game at Scottsdale Stadium. We hopped a golf cart and headed to a place I wanted to try; it was not open, yet. The cart driver suggested Salty's. I wish we had discovered this place a couple of days ago. While we were enjoying excellent street tacos and Salty's Original Fundido we were reading reviews. We could not understand all the negative reviews. The food was excellent and Markell provided us with top notch service. Ignore all those negative reviews. Grab a table on the patio and have some fun with friends.

F2WnLO8PcN0t9jc0LsyTpw.text: Great food and drinks! Tess was awesome and really stepped up. Definitely will be returning next time we're in town.

G-fFMs_wIwmBSBRNOL8S5Q.text: Came in for the bottomless mimosas, and an omelet. The food, drinks and service was great -- lived up to all positive reviews I've heard. Loved the environment and feel of the restaurant. The entire staff was upbeat and seemed to love working for Salty's, especially my waitress Lauren. She was very personable and timely. I will definitely be back.

IFFddZbwdOgDEpx3-DFq0A.text: Always a fun place.  Good AC in the summer and misters outside.  Ben behind the bar is boss.  Great drinks and super fast service, must stop by during happy hour.  A hot spot during spring training.

spxx4UWS7ILL4JxUc9XN8w.text: Perfect food portions, fantastic salsa (which seems to be different at most establishments), and super friendly staff.

YKUA-MINs0epAI5jH8qHJA.text: We spotted this place on a corner in Scottsdale.  The chicken tinga bowl was really good.  Do they have to charge extra for chips and salsa?  Really?  There's no need for that.  Otherwise, the whole experience was quite nice.

sPrkI4Uhqu1QW84DFuiJBA.text: The food was great but unfortunately I have to give a 1 star review due to the server. April was incredibly rude and acted like she didn't care. Half of our order came out wrong as if she wasn't listening when we were ordering. When we asked for the check she didn't come back to the table for over 20 minutes. I hope next time we are back in Scottsdale we are able to enjoy this place w out such rude and inconsiderate service.

Ppw8Q3C6QT7Q-vOZTLJn2Q.text: Awesome place on Tuesdays... Great, cheap street tacos and a beach cruiser bicycle giveaway. Check it out.

KzIrmkymrHCcnvdIIqMe3w.text: Went to the Salty Senorita for after dinner drinks.  I was with my wife and a friend. We waited for about 10 minutes for a waitress and decided to order our drinks from the bartender. The drinks were great. Excellent Margaritas. Waitress did finally come by and asked if we wanted food and we declined. Never saw her again. We did end up having to go back to the bartender for another round. It leaves no imagination as to why there were so many empty tables there on a Saturday evening. I guess everyone else knew what I no know. You go there for the drinks and you will not be disappointed as long as you do not expect much service. I'll bet the waitress doesn't understand why her tips are so low!

zr9KILTjub9feLP4nWbP8Q.text: Oh man, this place has gone downhill.  The service is barely adequate.  The food is really uninspired. My chicken lunch box came with soup and they didn't even give me a spoon to eat it with until ten minutes after my food was delivered. They do have a nice front patio to have a couple of drinks but that's about all that is even remotely enjoyable at the Salty Senorita these days.

vMBeFvcUW3WKVrBA6k9uBQ.text: This is our go-to spot for tacos and amazing margaritas. We always have the sweetest waitresses and get the best customer service every time.

olXarwUwA2-Fg3WDDuth3w.text: This place is awesome and Kyra the bartender is unbelievable! ! Good food and great service!!

PINU9kVRtUHRmzEpuP87oQ.text: Checked in around 3:30-4PM today. We had a blonde server (can't remember her name unfortunately) but she was very kind and attentive.  We ordered the louboutin margaritas, tacos and the grilled shrimp bowl. The food and drinks were delicious! Customer service and food were on point. I felt the need to post because our server was outstanding! So if the manager is reading this please find out who was working the floor around because she did a stellar job. Will be back.

uJzhn6SD1O7XqsOf2dx1zA.text: I'm from out of town and was shopping in Scottsdale. I wanted somewhere quick and Mexican. I viewed their menu online and their tacos seems good so I thought why not?  I would never recommend to come here. The staff was all pleasant and nice. That was the best part. The food and atmosphere was a giant let down.  Atmosphere - its a cool beachy/mermaid restaurant. Tables were fine, so was booth. Yet after being there for about 10-15 minutes the giant bar area I was next to opened up to the outside...when it was 113 degrees!!! One giant whole side of the restaurant was wide open, letting all the heat pour in. Obviously in cooler weather this is a great feature. But literally on this day, the high was 114, it was 113 current and there was even an extreme heat advisory issued. It got so hot inside it was disgusting. I had about 1/3 of a soda left that turned to water in less than 10 minutes because of the heat, all the ice cubes instantly melt. It was nasty feeling and I wanted to leave ASAP. Even if the AC was on you couldn't feel it and was a waste.  Food- I wanted to try 3 tacos and their street corn. The tacos were fine, but just fine. The street corn was terrible. First, it wasn't a cob, it was in a bowl. The corn was garbage. It was either canned or frozen, but it certainly was not fresh. Very disappointed. The rice the tacos came with was also dry and crunch on top, meaning it was dished and sitting for a while or was dried out with heat lamps/microwave heating.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Street corn. In a bowl. With old, nasty corn.
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. White fish, steak and cheese and pina carnitas tacos. Rice was dry. Didn&#39;t try beans
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Yes, open up half the restaurant to let the heat flood in on an excessive heat warning day...

DEpEtHXzEs4op8V2K7pz3w.text: I'm visiting my best friend and we wanted to hit a good happy hour and came across Salty Senorita. The name alone seemed like a good enough reason to go because it's funny. We sat outside at first but it was 1000 degrees so we moved inside so we didn't die of a heat stoke.   Our waitress Maria was amazing. Very attentive and energetic the entire time we were there. I asked her for recommendations and she was very helpful.   I ordered the surf and turf skewers which were delicious and my steak was cooked correctly and not over cooked at all which a lot of places struggle with when it comes to skewers. The shrimp was good as well and the entire skewer was seasoned great. The green tea shot was super good. I've only ever had them when I come to AZ because if forget they are a thing until I come here. My only minor complaint would be that the happy hour margarita is very salty. It was tolerable and the prickly pair flavoring I added helped to mask it a bit. But the salt taste was quite prominent in the drink. However, I would go back again. Everything else as great and they were very accommodating when we asked to move due to the heat. No complaints at all from the staff and they were kind and helpful.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Happy hour tacos
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. House Marg (happy hour) Prickly pear flavored and a green tea shot
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Surf &amp; Turf islands skewer

vHABwztwRR8n4M71wFMFdw.text: Came here on a Sunday mid-day before heading off to some Scottsdale Sunday Funday shenanigans. To start things off, the restaurant was pretty slow (dare I say dead), so I expected a somewhat average quality of service (I usually cut a restaurant some slack when they are slammed). Our group of 10 ordered bottomless mimosas, which took a VERY long time to come. Once they did come, our server left, never to be seen again. Eventually, a few of us got desperate after waiting for a while with empty glasses and had to bother the bartender, who apologized for the wait and was more than happy to give us refills (5 stars for that bartender!) When the food came, we had to triple check orders with the foodrunner. Our table's order overall was correct, but when he handed them out, he kept saying names that were different than was was written on the menu, and dropped them at the wrong seats, causing a fair bit of confusion. The food was decent but nothing to really write home about. Once we started wrapping up, it once again took a while to get our server's attention so we could get boxes and cash out. Overall, 1 star for our server, 5 stars for the bartender, and 3 for the food. If I'm ever in old town and want a Mexican style brunch, I may consider coming here again and just hoping i get a different server.

lWG7KwNU7v_p056MYtKXLQ.text: My friend and I went to The Salty Senorita for drinks on a Thursday night. We were seated quickly and enjoyed the beautiful AZ weather by seating in Salty Senorita's large outdoor seating area. The restaurant wasn't very crowded, our service was quick and there were no smokers in the patio area.  My friend and I enjoyed Rocky Point Flights and favored the Sunny Siesta. I wish the Blackout margarita was spicier, it tasted like a regular house margarita. The La Paloma was too sweet for my taste, I couldn't finish it. I am glad I tried the Rocky Point flight because it is hard to choose with so many margarita options. Next time I will only get the Sunny Siesta.  Our server was very attentive and quick.  I was surprised that there were no complimentary chips and salsa. All Mexican restaurants I've been to offer complimentary chips and salsa.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. The Rocky Point Flight. Photographed left to right: Blackout, La Paloma and Sunny Siesta.
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Love the Flight options! I tried the Rocky Point flight and loved the Sunny Siesta.
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

4NGXyDuLv6H1PfWut0Eq0Q.text: We were meeting a relative would had just flown in from LA and thought this would be a great place for Saturday lunch. We weren't disappointed. We sat outside and were served drinks very quickly.  We were slow in ordering food which didn't seem to bother the waiter. He kept us topped up with drinks. The food we ordered was lovely and tasty. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff there. Would good back there again.

1LOUGGDBXm95VrPhvJ9YXA.text: So slow! Restaurant was half empty, took 90 minutes to get dinner and another 30 for desert.  We had 2 birthdays, 2 desserts ( they did not charge for the birthday desserts) came out at different times with no extra spoons for the table. Staff had excuses when we complained about waiting so long. Food was ok. Would not return.

NQqmcQqe1Pkk9iXaCdX2GA.text: Update 8/31/18: This was my husband and I's second time coming back here! In retrospect of my review the prices are definitely reasonable. Our waitress, Chelsea was so amazing. She had great suggestions for us, and checked on us frequently. We tried the seafood enchiladas which I highly recommend. We had a few drinks and stayed for about an hour and a half. We sat more in the dining area rather than the bar and truthfully that made a difference to our experience. We met with Jim (if you've seen the comment for this review), and he was such a great host and super generous. I'm so glad we gave this place a second shot, it's close to us and the food was amazing. Look forward to coming back!  ----------------------------------------------------  First time coming to this place, I definitely would say if you come to expect not great service. Our waitress let us know that she was training someone today, which is no biggie (congratulations, ya know?) but then they disappeared. It took a good 15 minutes to receive our food, which was great. You have to pay for chips and salsa which is weird, most Mexican restaurants it's an automatic gesture to the table. Would come back to try the margaritas, their alcohol selection is pretty wide range

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

c-94l1Gzc-Dgy_XGpF1e-A.text: My family and I came to this location on a Saturday morning to enjoy some drinks and shareable plates. It was so quiet when we arrived that I was worried they were closed. Luckily they were opened with just a few customers at the bar.   We ordered a round of drinks and appetizer plates that included: chicken quesadilla, ceviche and taquitos. The food was okay, nothing to complain about but also nothing to rave about.   However, the reason for my lower review is due to the service and lack of urgency or attentiveness. If this location was incredibly busy or understaffed, we would understand why it was slower or harder for our waitress to keep up on our orders or requests. The unfortunate thing is it wasn't busy. It took a very long time to order, receive our food and drinks. At one point we gave our card in advance to pay but she didn't check on us in a while to ask for extra orders, give the check or even run the card.  It's unfortunate that the experience wasn't worthwhile and even made me think back to how quiet it was when we arrived. I wonder if the food and service could be the cause. I hope they get better, it's a great area and there is a lot of potential.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. El pepino margarita

VgzCcRPNp8pOiHA1CGUFuw.text: Fun place to eat and mingle when the weather is beautiful. This restaurant has a California feel when it comes to its food and seating. Huge patio and every table has its own big size umbrella.   The menu offers fish, burritos, tacos and enchiladas. Many of the items come with avocado so very California style. I went with the enchiladas. They offer black beans which I'm not a fan off. That's okay though. I still enjoyed the food. The rice actually had flavor. The enchiladas were very tasty. The chips and salsa were good. The salsa was a little spicy but when you're drinking it doesn't matter.   There is a happy hour for drinks and food. The inside of the restaurant smells delicious!! The staff is nice and the manager is doing is job and not hiding in the back.   I will be back.

IT-vy7JSIBMEOtW2aTg9Ww.text: My friends and I were in town for a weekend and came here on a Saturday afternoon and had a kick ass time. We were originally trying to go to RnR across the street, and it was packed and stupid loud, so we ended up here and boy am I glad we did.   The outdoor seating is awesome, the queso and ceviche are delicious, and the margaritas were spot on. The server was super high energy which was great - only downside was he basically disagreed with everything we ordered and tried to get us to order something else, which was a little off putting.   Ultimately, we ordered what we wanted and it was all fabulous. We had exactly the afternoon we were looking to have here and I am very glad we ended up here instead of the place across the street!

zFZtn86fj0AututQ9w0tfg.text: Decided to give this place a try this evening after we "escaped the room". They have a good selection of Happy Hour options on the menu. So I went for three Marco's fish tacos. I also had their black beans on the side.   I really enjoyed the food. The tacos came out lookin' all good n' sexy, with their thin homemade corn tortillas, the fish was delicious and the ration of cabbage/sauce/cheese was just right. I could have had a few more they were so tasty. The biggest surprise was the black beans though. The flavor of those beans was absolutely fabulous. After that first bite you're like, "Damn, these some good ass beans"! Lol.   Our sever Sarah J was awesome. Extremely friendly and kept on top of our drinks and everything else. All in all we had a great experience here and will be back in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Three happy hour Marco&#39;s fish tacos, with their black beans on the side.

9gJHZoOXqVNDEfNAs05Z0g.text: Had a boys dinner on the patio at salty and this is our new favorite place.  Lauren was our girl and she's taken care of us back to back visits.  One of the coolest people.  I think she's got a little crush on me but can't tell for sure.  She hides it well.  Anyhow, this girl is on her stuff.  Never had to ask for a refill, knows how to sell, and is bubbly af.   Salty has new regulars

awFk4eIvn36kQ44KsDyYjQ.text: I really like starting a night out in Old Town at Salty's. I'll grab a seat at the outside bar and try one of their margaritas to get in the mood for a night out on the town. My favorite is the watermelon margarita which is delicious and refreshing!  The food is also pretty good here.   The only disappointment was the chicken tortilla soup which was tomato based and tasted like carrots.   Instead go for the tacos which are always pretty good!

7Y3FhLSHsFQu_FC1hDkzNg.text: I have been here before but just got chips and margaritas. This time we went for food. It wad nice that we didn't have to wait for a table during lunch time in Old Town on a Sunday but after eating and our service, we found out why.  Our server was polite but for a place that wasn't very busy, she forgot that we ordered appetizers and was incredibly slow.  The food was very disappointing. It was borderline cold and just not very good. Kids chicken strips were dry, my shrimp bowl was terrible and the burrito was ok. We could have done better at Chipotle.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Dry chicken strips
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. mediocre burrito
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. NOT good shrimp bowl. The cheese was melted but was cold.

TkGEh5ls8KSGDzBiNQREQQ.text: Great tacos! The absolute best salsa and quest dip in town. They make the chips here along with the salsa. It's all homemade. Our waitress was Chelsea and she was spectacular. Quick to bring us drinks and food and we didn't do without a thing. I can't recommend this place enough. The margaritas are epic too!

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Steak Tacos
Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States. Cabo Wabo Margarita

DPTPL22Oj-XhyFBR2N4lVQ.text: Great place to sit outside and have a few drinks with friends. Right in heart of old town so when hopping around from bar to bar this would be perfect place to end your night.

46H8IiUHOm8Lgp220nBsBg.text: I went in last night, after waiting for a long time for my food, they bring me my order wrong. I decided to just shared the enchiladas with my boyfriend since I didn't want to wait longer for a redo. The enchiladas were so salty we felt pretty sick that night. So disappointing.

FH1aU5DrnP6KhNdTvVgXZA.text: Great atmosphere, food and drinks! Ask for Chelsea and you may get a free tshirt! Would definitely go back.

photos.caption: Photo of Salty Senorita - Scottsdale, AZ, United States

dmmTHUkPCrBWQWsLmLvLyw.text: Hello     We just visited July 10th around 1pm. The place was pretty empty at this time. So i have no clue what the nights and or busy times are like. My Wife enjoyed the pulled pork tacos and i had the steak fajitas.  All the food was good. Also very happy the tacos were gluten free!  The service was very good also!  Nice work on the 10th!  Oh and the inside is pretty neat as well!  We will be back when in town!

gVIQm_Wvd6WRN_gpQi-l5Q.text: These guys don't give a sh*t about their customers. My group has holding our events here for years just out of tradition, but we're going to be choosing a new venue. The bartenders here are such douche bags. If you complain about one thing, they'll give you an attitude. They'll even refuse to serve you or intentionally stall if you give them any trouble. It's the same thing the last two times we went. And the crazy thing is that the managers don't care either. As long as people keep giving them money for bad service, they're never going to change.  Food is good though lol.

h6PQJxoGemoBT_2BbOn5QQ.text: This is my Sunday brunch place everytime i'm in Scottsdale. Absolutely delish fajitas and and I love their extensive Margarita menu. Their Sunday make-your-own-bloody mary bar is the best :). They have an awesome wait staff as well.... Not complaints. Happy Customer :)

tWu89BrxiYVIzz5JBwWIUQ.text: I miss the old Salty Seniorita! Why? The new location's margaritas are half the size (even though the glass is made to look big) so, in effect, they are double the cost. Our bill was twice what it used to be for the same amount of alcohol. Also miss the slushy margaritas! I was excited to check out the new location but feel no desire to return. A financial rip-off!

drsT3WXNWtB7vlmRaiMeVw.text: It's a good place to start a pub crawl. We usualy start and work our way into Old Town from there. The tablemade guacamole is where it's at though! I get it everytime and have never been disappointed. The margarita samplers are a great way for a group to get the night started. We usually get 2 or 3 samplers for 4 people and pass them around so everyone can find their favorite margarita (tip, keep your straw!).

Uy2nj1uPwS47FkSsFOKfwA.text: Looks a lot better than it is. While the food isn't horrible, it's overpriced for what you get (both quality and quantity) - if it wasn't so expensive, I'd give the food 3 stars, as it is, 2 stars. Had one specialty drink, the one they make at your table (their website is currently not working for their margarita list) and was extremely underwhelmed.   Service was good, but out of the numerous places my mother and I ate at this weekend in Scottsdale, this was by far our least favorite. Will not be back.

INI-IxBTchX4Mwmh6YqE9Q.text: Food wasn't worth the price.  Their red sauce was like tomato paste & I couldn't figure out why a cantina would blare rock/blues music?!  The nachos were good though.

nAfufu8yl-jo_kdH--P7Qw.text: If I could give Salty Senorita a '0" I probably would because it is terrible. I can only echo what the majority of reviews say: new Satly's totally lacks the good service, creative menu, and ambience of the old.   My recommendation: Don't bother! Visit another fine eatery in Scottsdale--there are many--all better than Salty's at this time. Maybe in the future Salty Senorita will regain its glory of old. But, for now, stay away.

A0z8Uasc57vBnCUgRO5tqA.text: Got the Estella's fish taco. It was really good.   It was a small street style taco. Fish tasted fresh not frozen. I liked the avocado slice and limes to squeeze on.

v2OC46hhQK8eqfE13DRcgg.text: Fantastic patio for some food and drinks. Great staff. Samantha and Miranda are the best in Old Town!

JeR5Dunf3jqUcNgtlLcXPg.text: All in all this was a fun joint, though the food was only okay. Best enjoyed as a place for drinks and appetizers with friends.    Service was friendly and responsive.  My orders were promptly served and my water glass was always topped off.    Great selection of tequillas, mezcals, and margaritas. The blanco margarita took care of me, yummy!    The appetizers and salsa are great, but the main dishes are only okay. Unless of course you're into piles of industrial-grade cheddar cheese on everything.  I ordered a carnitas burrito because cheddar wasn't listed as a feature, unlike everything else, and it came with gobs both inside and on top. Wet means saucy, not cheesy! Could barely taste the meat.  Very disappointing after a good start.

aISNtYczIqcIiCSQVqz4bQ.text: I love this place. They have the best damn bloody marys in scottsdale.  Xenia was great with providing us with top notch service.

7wFYKKMKV_8PgaRJzSra4g.text: Salsa is good and nice thin crisp chips.  Asked for a flight of tequilas and the barmaid and manager stared at the collection like a dog watching tv.  Barman #2 had a slight clue, but basically, they don't know their 51 (closer to 40) tequilas.  Sangrita lame.  Not coming back.

8QDvySe2paWISpLMoJdoWw.text: I went to Salty's and had the best experience with Brittany! I had a delicious breakfast burrito and great service my whole time spent on the patio! Brittany was awesome and it was a fun atmosphere!

7W5fRUdlv1cCdLoAtCOcrg.text: Cute little restaurant that we went to on a whim.  It's busy and loud, but the service was good and the food was tasty.  I had fish tacos and enjoyed them.  Wait staff was attentive and fast.  We sat on the patio, which was nice; the indoor dining looked just as nice.  Clearly a place for college kids, spring training baseball fans (mostly SF Giants), and tourists driving down Scottsdale Road or wandering over from Old Town.  But fast, cheap, and a nice little diversion if you're looking for something loose and casual.

3Aw_URfwsW9dM14YiozcPA.text: I've boozed here a few times...but until a co-worker suggested we grab lunch there this afternoon, I never even thought about getting food there.  I'm a fan of their bar.  The margaritas are great.  The food was okay.  Nothing I'd write home about.  But I'd bet that my food would have tasted better if I was feeling buzzed from a marg (the Salty Seniorita is my favorite).  They have lunch specials that are $6.99 and the portions are a bit smaller than the bigger meals.  It takes a lot to fill me up, so the lunch special was a bit smaller than I would have liked...but I left satisfied.

y8xWhIkrtQ1FldVUIJ42ow.text: Ruben and Kristen are amazing....they add to the great atmosphere!  Great bar tenders always a step ahead of what we want!

3V0xGvO3cYLlsGWvoP0idw.text: came here for lunch with some friends and our bad luck it was a spring training game for some team.  unlucky for us because they had a limited menu because of this game.  its only spring training haha who cares and what restaurant only has a special menu for spring training.    our drink we got had little to no alcohol and we had to actually ask them to put more liquor in it.  no point in spending 10 bucks a drink on a fruity non alcoholic drink.  food was ok. nothing special.  just was the only place that a seat available. i see why now

ANJcuKhn6XlOmBouz6-WVw.text: We always have a great time here on the patio! They have a great happy hour and be sure say hi to Barry one of the best bartenders in old town!

tIMU0XamuzhB5ZnobeAE9g.text: Spring training tour staple. Been coming here on my yearly group trip with my buddies and cannot believe I have not written a review. Don't let the stars deter you.  The drinks are reasonable and the food is tasty.  I recommend the chipotle chicken bowl. The staff is awesome and attentive. Marisa helped us out last night and had great food and drink recs. Ask her about the angel water! Don't waste your time at the other knock off Mexican joints in Scottsdale. Head straight to salty for some pre game or post game margs and tacos.

rJAxBzNCnlzuqzhg-cefow.text: Food was just ok, but service with a smile is well worth the price of admission. Ask for Marisa I was impressed

FoQSSwTj2Jrc09q_ChBvgQ.text: So Nicole was ridiculously amazing... Good personality and attentive .. Great new place

6YCUBuGMRMIQ48Fj1FkBsg.text: I only go there for lunch, great taco's, super service, I go 2 or 3 times a month and the bartender remembers my name. Table side Guac is great....Love the place although it could be a tad less expensive.

1lNKDr93oIJZpFSdWZDWiQ.text: Oh what can I say? My boyfriend and I were in town visiting from L.A. when we stumbled upon this place. We had just driven down from the Grand Canyon and Sedona and boy were we hungry! What initially caught our eye was the fun outdoor patio/bar setting so we decided to stop and see what this place had to offer. As soon as we walked in we were greeted in a very welcoming way and our server came to our table instantly. She right away made suggestions to us and we decided on the Nachos and the Grilled Shrimp tacos. Oh My God!!!! I had never had nachos that tasted soo good! Now I'm back home in L.A. and I keep telling my boyfriend that we HAVE to go back for those nachos because I'm seriously salivating for them!!!!

EQWhtsj0t-ElTC_-zGhhBg.text: Markell did and fantastic job taking care of us today. Super friendly, great bartender! Five stars all the way.

MNC6i32ixFqTgSHZ4pJZWg.text: So, I came here after the new location opened. I was sad because service was slow or simply missing in action, BUT I am so glad I returned!  They've got their stuff together now! Service for brunch today was fabulous.  I never saw the bottom of my mimosa glass and the food has improved greatly. We will be back!!! Thank you!!!

WPgvmBhnJ6tIABy8QZNk0g.text: The best freak'n tacos I've had in my entire Mexican life. NO JOKE! I had the blackened fish taco and the carne asada taco. Both were delicious. Chips and salsa were great too. Outdoor seating on an Arizona hot night? NO problem because they have outdoor coolers that make it a great night.  Love this place. You will too.

DMWJvXCu9s3NBh3hJ-_5Jw.text: Salty's is gnarly and Krys is the best server ever and so is Brian (manager) is cool BUT I couldn't hustle a free shirt out of him. No for real though everyone is super sick this place is legit.   *** Disclaimer-----I'm still drunk hehe

x2iRjJyslBILQc5HhCW2Tw.text: This was our destination after every spring training game at Scottsdale stadium. Tip a golf cart and you'll be there in a flash. We never ate there but they did bring tasty chips and salsa. I think we ordered guac too and it was good.   I don't understand the low ratings but te beer is cheap. There's a ton of waitresses and they do a decent job of paying attention to their areas. They are all attractive too.   I remember the beer prices being reasonable and the patio is the place to be. I would say this is spot is as popular as momos is to giants home games. Minus the fine dining.

7TV47I5BcxJSaRq3s7OdZQ.text: To me this place is just okay.  The drinks are okay, I don't love nor hate them and the food is okay.  In trying to write this review there's nothing really memorable about the whole place.  Nothing negative which is a good thing, but nothing positive either.  This place is easily forgettable and a little bit boring to me and my friends when we went.  I don't see myself returning there anytime soon.

6wQo13PbregztZDId3BMrA.text: I can't rate this place low enough. I was a good customer of the old saltys. The old place was decent food, cheap drinks and good service. This new Saltys is terrible!!! I ordered a Coors light draft and it was 4.50. What the heck? My PBR was a small can and 3 bucks. I'm pretty sure this will be my last time here. Good bye Saltys and good luck staying open with all these bad reviews.

boZkgHN9HpNnnOxK59KsQw.text: Top-notch during off hours and tool-shed during peak hours.  I've been here multiple times: morning, day, night, weekend, sunday mornings, et cetera. I've never had any issues here. The girls are cute (ASU slooties), but the dudes are tools. I get it. Don't let it dissuade your decision. The staff is great and very personable.  If you're lucky enough to go there on a Sunday morning, you might ask for a mimosa, however, you'll get a MANmosa (if you're a dude). No joke I ordered a mimosa and she came back with a giant glass and said, "I could have put it in one of those cute flutes, but I figured this suited you better." Good call.   I visit this place regularly when I'm in town.   Cheers

vGAw6W8LD1qbhGu9oIIAeA.text: It was my friends bachelorette celebration, so we decided to head here after a show at talking stick resort. We got there around 9PM tonight, Saturday night, and there were maybe 6 people inside and about 20 outside, it was deader than dead. The bartender was very friendly, we all ordered drinks and he was upbeat. The drinks were absolutely horrific. Two tequila sunrises and a vodka soda should be easy enough. We took them outside to enjoy the evening and hoped it would pick up. Got out there and we all about spit out our drinks they were so terrible. I tried to drink mine thinking maybe something wasn't right with me lol! Then my other friend said her drink was so bad she didn't think she could drink it. We decided enough was enough, between being dead as it gets to the worst drinks we ever had, it was time to bounce. Gave it 2 stars because the bartender was very nice. We didn't complain about the drinks since we weren't sure if he were to of comped them he'd have to eat the price himself. We left the drinks full at the table and headed out for the rest of the evening. I had heard this place was really fun and great drinks so needless to say, it was a massive let down.

yRlErWnqrq5cvEFffRgvYQ.text: Inconsistent! I like to bring clients here for a good margarita and some decent apps. Service was great but I only go when I know Elizabeth is working. I decided to try the Sunday brunch and WOW! what a disappointing experience. We ordered from the brunch menu and the regular menu. Elizabeth suggested the tostadas from the brunch menu and it came out soggy. The tacos we ordered were dry and had no flavor. Come on guys...get it together!!! I know this place has potential. OH! and one more minus...the restaurant has no air conditioning! Our poor server was melting before our eyes and it was so uncomfortably warm that it was near impossible to eat. Get some air flow in there!!

3GqrBlPBzBCKinr1urymZg.text: Don't bother eating here. Tacos were not fresh and not presented well. Walk a block or two and eat better someplace else. #igotabadtasteiymouth

mtacmdLcTWXtp5R8Z9UTrA.text: I loveddddd the old salty senorita they had great burritos, fundado cheese dip and steak salad and of course margarita and great happy hour. I never thou a new location will change this place . I order my appetizer and a margarita and they didn't have frozen machine yet OK I can understand its a new location... we placed our orders and I want it to try something different I order chicken burrito and a chicken fajita order. First we never got the appetizer and the main course was not good my rice was hard and looks and taste old, the beans were hard the chicken was ok . I ask for the hot sauces on the side and they put inside. At the end we order another round of drinks cause we need a drink after eating that and we never got our drinks. Service was OK I guess. All im saying I know they are new and all... But please bring my old salty senorita back !!!!! you guys can do it.

fubQUVEsQaP7FqDfZG0wPQ.text: Food is fantastic as usual.  Staff is friendly and I never have to wait for service.  A+++

eA_u2YWP4sR3z6bAV5S3TQ.text: Nicole is a very helpful server because she's very knowledgeable about the menu and Scottsdale. Which makes my company very happy, because I come from the Philippines. I recommend this place more than other restaurants and hope Nicole will always. Work here.

znQF5t6_pDNCftsO6R8VSg.text: I've been coming to Salty's for a few years now, but have lagged on ever writing a review. With that being said, my visit a few Tuesdays ago pushed me to do so.  I went in randomly, expecting to grab a few drinks and some food, only to realize that they have a live DJ and were raffling beach cruisers.  I didn't think much of it, but decided to wager my luck and obtain a ticket by checking in on FB, and I WON!!!  Aside from this fortunate occurrence, the service was truly above average.  I had three bartenders rotating to help me, all of who were extremely friendly and seemed excited about their beach themed bar for the evening.  To the ladies that created such a fun environment (Xe, 'Bebo', and Erin), THANK YOU!!!

yAuygTsGEGkl05OMtpCQOA.text: Had a wonderful experience with Nicole @ saltys! What great margs. The tacos r fabulous! Service is great

kXCYtWofJVVwMW_jOvJSVQ.text: Salty Senorita has great margaritas and great drink specials. I ordered a fish bowl and it consisted of a huge margarita with a Coronita upsidedown in it. It wasn't super strong but I got a good buzz out of it. It was some kind of special, I think it was called Margarita Monday so it was gigantic and only $6!! The food was mediocre and was overpriced in my eyes. The only thing that stood out considering the food was the fact the the waitress made the guacamole from scratch at the table! Talk about fresh! It was so good and the table demolished it. I would return for drinks, especially if I were craving a margarita but probably not for food.

IGfygJzaIzyHIkWIjKMTTA.text: I just need to say, this place is unethical and dishonest. I went here with a friend a couple of nights ago and the waitress had gone out of her way to change my $10 tip into a $20 tip. I called the manager who admitted the tip had been scribbled out on the credit card slip and re-written. If I didn't catch it, the manager led me to believe that this was business as usual and would have gone unnoticed. This is a not a place I will ever return to and I advise you to be weary of taking your business here.

uMO4WHvE4cJPJurMgaKJPg.text: Stopped in for some apps and drinks after the dinner rush and got a great patio seat. We sampled most of the taco menu; coca cola beef rib and rock fish stick in my mind but all were good. Some of the drinks seemed too boozy but the half sangria half margarita was very good. Service was attentive and knowledgeable.

9lgGy0H5pqQ3z1TyVBuTQw.text: Went for Taco Tuesdays....and tacos are $1 (steak or chicken).  They were super yummy.  They let you choose corn or flour tortillas...go with flour...so good.  Then we had a bucket of Coronitas for only 5 bucks.  Very good deal.    The environment was awesome...they had a dj but it wasn't too loud...great place to go.   The frozen margaritas are delicious AND pretty big.    Happy hour, taco Tuesdays, and Reverse Happy Hour are perfect at this place!

BVSkGter-KiDWAwPTn-BFA.text: The reason I'm gonna give  it 4 star is the drinks. They are awesome and they have a good variety of tequilas and mezcals. I have had some of the food. Its ok. Sunday Funday here for some day drinking on the patio is the best. If you want the best service, sit at the bar. Beware of the UNDERTOW. WOW!

nT19OumOogBuXXebwTn3nA.text: Salty Senorita's isn't the place to go if you crave authentic Mexican food.  As a matter fact the food is ordinary at best. The in-house salsa is pretty good though as is their cheese dip.  However if you're looking for generic Americanize Mexican food it's not too bad I guess.  Where Salty's excels is the outdoor and open air seating in a cool part of town. Even on hot days misters keeps things cool.  Coupled with a good house Margarita, cold beer and good music it's easy to get swept up in an afternoon or evening of relaxed drinking with a few friends. There always seems to be some sort of discounted drink or food special.  Baseballs spring training brings even more specials.  Service is typically good and if sitting at the bar better than average.  At first glance Salty Senorita's is the type of place I avoid. Yet I usually find myself enjoy stopping in. My advice is to have dinner somewhere else, then stop in for a few drinks.

5C03zkzYJNGRMhBSBtrgig.text: Love their Salty Senoritas aka Cadillac margaritas!  Lovely patio, great ambience, good service from the bartenders - will be definitely back to try the ceviche and guac!

kbbRmbb6LNvFmvdwbXz7Bg.text: Really good Mexican food.  All of us enjoyed our meal.  The waitress was fantastic.  Very attentive, very friendly.  What I didn't care for was the DJ.  He play some funky weird tracks.  More of club dance theme rather than a restaurant food theme.    Beyond that good place to eat if you want Mexican...

GW3aAgWo8j-l9C1C_s5FmA.text: Awful service is all I have to say.....10 mins for waitress to even show up, 20 mins to get chips and salsa (which cost money) after finally ordering, 15 min to get margarita after ordering , 30 min  to have ordered finally taken.....never an offer to refill drink or anything...... and it wasn't even very busy yet

jAZvNY6GKeRkAXZV755Z6w.text: My friends and I came here because of a recommondation.  Looking from the outside, the looks attractive because of the outdoor seating.  Upon entering, we were greeted immediatley.  We were asked if we wanted to sit outside or inside and we chose to dine inside the restaurant because it was too hot.  My problem eating inside is that the music is too loud.  It's very difficult to converse when the volume is turned up to the max.  My friend's father asked our waitress to lower the volume so we can talk, but we didn't notice the difference.  Oh well.  On with the food.  We were provided with chips and salsa and I was dissappointed.  The salsa was bland and too runy.  I believe Chevy's salsa taste better than this.   The food is standard tex mex restaurant menu and prices.  I ordered the chicken fajitas and they were very good and tasty.  I was so full that I was unable to finish it.  My wife ordered the the shrimp quesidilla and it was okay.  My friends enjoyed their food, but nothing to knock us of our feet.  As I wrote earlier, other than the chips and sales everything else was ok. Nothing to call home about, but also not worth complaining about either.   Our waitress was very friendly and attentive and the ambitance is very lively.  Overall...if you want tex mex, nachos and maragaritas...The Salty Senorita is the place for you.

t8c0LTfEn_i0im8pSVwU7g.text: I was in town from Chicago and we stopped at Salty Senorita for a few drinks.  JK was our bartender and he was incredibly attentive and gave us really good suggestions on what we should try.  Food and drinks both were outstanding but would def go back for the great service!!!

io05L9LhMg7_pTEwh4ez2g.text: Victoria is a superstar!  She was very attentive and focused on us as people, not just bodies in her station.  My friend is gluten intolerant and was asking general questions about the menu but did not state she needed a special menu. Victoria intuitively asked her coworkers and can back and told my friend that they have a gluten free menu.  She went one extra step further to check with the kitchen on an appetizer we had already ordered.  Get out of her way she is headed places far beyond Salty Senorita!  Ask for her when you go here, you will be treated like royalty!

g_Pa6fnEXFr2fRJuUx6zyg.text: TERRIBLE SERVICE... Sat down outside at 420 on a friday afternoon, the college  boys that sat down 5-10 minutes after us were greeted before us.
